attributes.action: Every PCT district should provide the NICE recommendation with regards to IVF for the HFEA to enforce 'Single Embryo Transfer' (SET)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The HFEA have brought into effect starting from January 2009 that every clinic offering IVF must reduce their statistics from 25% of multiple births to below 10% by 2012.

To do this clinics are giving the majority of their patients only one embryo transfer instead of the usual two which in turn is decreasing the average success rate by over a quarter.

If the HFEA are to enforce this policy they must first have every PCT give the recommended 3 cycles of IVF available on the NHS. NICE guidelines state three cycles should be made available for the 'SET' plan to work.

I believe the issue is going to be about compensating for the reduced success rate by giving people the number of cycles that Nice recommends, which is not currently happening."
